name: Yuk Chuk Siu
description: The two ingredients needed to define the encoding of a set of symbols are 1) decide how many bits are we going to use in encoding  and 2) define a correspondence between symbols and binary encoding.Size of Encoding with 'n' bits ,  we have 2^n combinations and 2^n must be greater or equal to number of elements in a set.How to encode Characters?using the concept of catalog of correspondencenowadays computers use Unicode to encode charactersUAL-1consisting of 3 elements: code, operand 1 and operand 2.where code is divided into four possible values: ADD, SUB, MUL, DIVand operand 1 and 2 are divided into 256 possible values ranging from 0 to 255UAL-1 can also have 4*256*256 = 2^18 symbols meaning it will at least have 18 bits.Scheme: for a 24 bits encoding2 bits are for the 'Code'8 bits are for the 'Operand 1'8 bits are for the 'Operand 2'another 8 bits are zeros

name: Siyi Chen
description: This video explained how to encode sets of symbols.We need to encode symbols as 24 bits, with 2 bits of code (ADD 00, MUL 10, SUB 01, DIV 11), 8 bits of operand 1,  8 bits of operand 2 and 6 bits all zeros.

name: Wing Kiu Ng
description: The two ingredients needed to define the encoding of a set of symbols:-the number of bits-the correspondence symbols (binary encoding)

name: Wing Kiu Ng
description: A catalog of correspondence is a table that shows all the characters and their corresponding codes

name: Wing Kiu Ng
description: the 2nd operand can have any number between 0 and 255

name: Wing Kiu Ng
description: The video describes the method for encoding symbols. What determine this type of encoding include the number of bits and the corresponding symbols. The number of bits is related to the number of combinations. For example if there are 8 combinations, 3 bits are needed since 8 = 2^3. The bits are represented by the power of base 2.UAL- 1 is another way for encoding symbols. It is determined by three parts: the code, operand 1 and operand 2. The code consists of (ADD, SUB, MUL, DIV) while both operands can have any number between 0 and 255.

name: Brendan Allan March
description: This video describes how to encode a set of symbols.1) Choose no. of bits (n) to encode set symbols with, using the formula 2^n >= |Set|.2) Describe how the symbols are going to be encoded [ie: how to interpret the string of n bits].The video then gives an example of this process.
